title: The Rigged Employee Vote
setting: Oakmont Media Group, HR office, Wednesday 4 PM
premise: The anonymous employee satisfaction survey was tampered with — fifty fake negative responses were submitted to make the CEO look bad. The fake entries were all submitted between 2 AM and 4 AM Tuesday from an office computer.

suspects.name: Chloe Bergman
suspects.motive: Wants the CEO replaced so she can push her candidate for the position
suspects.alibi: I was at home Tuesday night. I took a sleeping pill at 10 PM because I had an early flight Wednesday. My flight was at 6 AM and I set three alarms. I slept right through.

suspects.name: Russ Whitfield
suspects.motive: The CEO cut his department's budget by forty percent last quarter
suspects.alibi: I was working a freelance editing job from home all night. I had a midnight deadline for an article. I submitted it at 11:52 PM and then went straight to sleep.

suspects.name: Anita Kapoor
suspects.motive: Discovered the CEO was cooking metrics and wants him removed before an audit
suspects.alibi: I was at the office late running quarterly reports. I left around 1 AM Tuesday. The parking garage attendant saw me leave. I drove home and didn't come back.

suspects.name: Derek Fontaine
suspects.motive: Being laid off at the end of the month as part of restructuring
suspects.alibi: I was home playing online games with friends all night. We were in a voice chat from 11 PM to 4 AM. My friends in the chat can all confirm I was talking the entire time.

clues.title: Network Access Log
clues.content: The fake survey entries were submitted from a workstation that requires a staff ID badge to log in. The badge used belonged to Anita's account.

clues.title: Parking Garage Attendant
clues.content: The garage attendant confirms Anita left at 1:05 AM Tuesday. He also noted one car entered the garage at 1:45 AM — a red sedan. Anita drives a blue SUV.

clues.title: Gaming Platform Records
clues.content: Derek's gaming platform shows his last activity was at 12:30 AM Tuesday. The voice chat server logs show he disconnected at 12:32 AM — not 4 AM as he claimed.

hints.text: Focus on whether each suspect's alibi actually covers the 2 AM to 4 AM window.
Can online activity logs confirm how long that late-night gaming session really lasted?
